alert.note: Alert for Berks; Bucks; Lehigh; Montgomery; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 2:00PM EST until February 19 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST FOR NORTHEASTERN BERKS...LEHIGH...NORTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY...WEST CENTRAL BUCKS AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 200 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Lehigh University to near Cedarville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 45 and 62. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 67. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 11. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Reading, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Hellertown, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, East Greenville, Wernersville, Topton, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bally, Bechtelsville, Lyons and Coffeetown. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
